sen.j: 春画（しゅんが）とは、江戸時代に流行した性風俗（特に異性間・同性間の性行為場面）を描いた浮世絵の一種。
sen.e: Shunga (erotic arts) is a kind of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) that portrayed sexual culture (especially the scenes of sexual intercourse between the sexes or the same sex) that was in fashion in the Edo period.

Shunga (erotic arts) is a kind of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) that portrayed sexual culture (especially the scenes of sexual intercourse between the sexes or the same sex) that was in fashion in the Edo period.

Shunga (erotic arts) is a kind of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) that portrayed sexual culture (especially the scenes of sexual intercourse between the sexes or the same sex) that was in fashion in the Edo period.

sen.j: 笑い絵や枕絵、枕草紙、秘画、ワ印とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It was also referred to as waraie (a laugh picture), makurae (a pillow picture), makura-soshi (a pillow book) and wajirushi (lit. "wa" mark).
It was also referred to as waraie (a laugh picture), makurae (a pillow picture), makura-soshi (a pillow book), higa (pornographic picture) and wajirushi (lit. "wa" mark).

sen.j: また、それほど露骨な描写でない絵は危絵（あぶなえ）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Also, more moderate picture was referred to as abunae (lit. a dangerous picture)
Also, more moderate picture was referred to as abunae (lit. a dangerous picture)

sen.j: その描写は必ずしも写実的でなく、性器が大きく描かれることが多い。
sen.e: The description was not always realistic, often the size of the genitals were exaggeratingly described.
The description was not always realistic; often the size of the genitals were exaggeratingly described.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 春画の始まりは中国の医学書とともに伝えられた房中術の解説図だと思われる。
sen.e: It was considered that the shuga has its origin in Chinese sex manual graphics that were introduced with Chinese medical books.
It was considered that the shunga has its origin in Bocchujutsu (sexual art) that was introduced with Chinese medical books.
sen.cmt: 「房中術」の訳を用語集に合わせて変更shungaのスペルミスを修正
sen.e: It was considered that the shunga has its origin in Bocchujutsu (sexual art) that was introduced with Chinese medical books.

sen.j: 日本では平安時代初期から偃息図（えんそくず、おそくず）、またはおそくずの絵と呼ばれる性的題材を描いた絵画があったとされているが（『古今著聞集』など）。
sen.e: In Japan, in the early Heian Period, it is said that there was an picture known as ensokuzu, osozuzu, or osokuzu-no-e (erotic picture) that portrayed sexual theme, such as the ".Kokon chomon ju" (A collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan, in the early Heian Period, it is said that there was an picture known as ensokuzu, osozuzu, or osokuzu-no-e (erotic picture) that portrayed sexual theme, such as the "Kokon chomon ju" (a collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present).

In Japan, in the early Heian period, it is said that there was an picture known as ensokuzu, osozuzu, or osokuzu-no-e (erotic picture) that portrayed sexual theme, such as the "Kokon chomon ju" (a collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present).

sen.j: しかし、もともと「偃息図」という言葉自体が中国からきたものである。
sen.e: However, the term 'ensokuzu' itself has its origin in China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the term 'ensokuzu' itself has its origin in China.
However, the term 'ensokuzu' itself has its origin in China.

sen.j: それが庶民に、室町時代から江戸時代にかけて広がり、絵師たちによって描かれるようになった。
sen.e: From the Muromachi Period to the Edo Period, it became popular among common people, depicted by the painters.
From the Muromachi Period to the Edo Period, it became popular among common people and depicted by the painters.
From the Muromachi period to the Edo period, it became popular among common people and depicted by the painters.
sen.cmt: Muromachi Period to the Edo Period→Muromachi period to the Edo period

sen.j: 災難よけの一種のお守りとして使われるようになったり、特に枕絵の絵巻は花嫁の性教育のテキストとして使われた。
sen.e: It was used as a kind of good luck charm, especially the makurae picture scroll was used for a sexual manual for a bride.
It was used as a kind of good luck charm, especially the makurae picture scroll was used for a sexual manual for a bride.
It was used as a kind of good luck charm, especially the makurae picture scroll was used for a sexual manual for a bride.

sen.j: ただ、この時代は肉筆のため一部の上流階級のためのものであった。
sen.e: However, because it was hand painting, the shunga was still for upper class
However, because it was hand painting, the shunga was still for the upper class.
However, because it was hand painting, the shunga was still for the upper class.

sen.j: 桃山時代、明から春宮秘戯図が伝来し出版された。
sen.e: In the Momoyama Period, Shunkyu Higizu 春宮秘戯図 (The secret plays of the court) was introduced from Ming Dynasty and published.
sen.cmt: 『春宮秘戯図』読み方不明。仮読みです。
sen.e: In the Momoyama Period, Drawings for Secret Plays in a Bedchamber was introduced from the Ming Dynasty and published.
sen.cmt: 「春宮秘戯図」の訳を用語集に合わせて変更secretのスペルミスを修正
sen.e: In the Momoyama period, Drawings for Secret Plays in a Bedchamber was introduced from the Ming Dynasty and published.

sen.j: それに影響され日本でさかんに春画が描かれるようになった。
sen.e: It was influential forJapanese to depict the shunga actively.
It was influential in Japan in the growth of shunga.
It was influential in Japan in the growth of shunga.

sen.j: 初期の絵師としては菱川師宣が代表的であり、彼の作品の大半が春画である。
sen.e: In the early times, the most famous painter was Moronobu HISHIKAWA who mainly painted the shunga.
In the early times, the most famous painter was Moronobu HISHIKAWA who mainly painted the shunga.
In the early times, the most famous painter was Moronobu HISHIKAWA who mainly painted the shunga.

sen.j: また、井原西鶴の浮世草子、好色一代男が大流行する。
sen.e: Also, Ukiyozoshi (lit. Books of the Floating World) and Koshoku ichidai otoko (Life of an amorous man) written by Saikaku IHARA became very popular.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, Ukiyozoshi (lit. Books of the Floating World) and Koshoku ichidai otoko (Life of an amorous man) written by Saikaku IHARA became very popular.

sen.j: 好色物と呼ばれるジャンルが流行る。
sen.e: Then, the genre called as Koshoku mono (Tales of Gallantry) became in fashion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, the genre called as Koshoku mono (Tales of Gallantry) became in fashion.

sen.j: それにより、春画の需要が増える。
sen.e: It increased demands for the shunga.
It increased demands for the shunga.
It increased demands for the shunga.

sen.j: しかし享保7年（1722年）享保の改革により好色本が禁止される。
sen.e: However, in 1722, at the time of the Kyoho Reforms (the reforms made in the Kyoho era of the Edo period), erotic books were banned
However, in 1722, at the time of the Kyoho Reforms (the reforms made in the Kyoho era of the Edo period), erotic books were banned

sen.j: それでも需要があるためこれより非公開で販売されることとなる。
sen.e: Still it was secretly sold due to its demand.
Still it was secretly sold due to its demand.
Still it was secretly sold due to its demand.

sen.j: そして、錦絵の開発により、多色刷りの春画が寛政のころから本格的に登場しだした。
sen.e: Around 1789 to 1800, according to the development of the Nishiki-e(woodblock prints), multicolor painted shunga appeared in earnest.
Around 1789 to 1800, according to the development of the Nishiki-e (woodblock prints), multicolor painted shunga appeared in earnest.
Around 1789 to 1800, according to the development of the Nishiki-e (woodblock prints), multicolor painted shunga appeared in earnest.

sen.j: 江戸幕府の規定を守る必要がない春画は、通常では出版できない極彩色の作品が作られた。
sen.e: Beyond the rules and regulations enacted by the Edo shogunate, the shuga in full color was published that was ordinarily impossible.
Beyond the rules and regulations enacted by the Edo shogunate, the shuga in full color was published that was ordinarily impossible.

sen.j: そのため、浮世絵の最高の技術が使われているものは春画とも言われている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is said that the most significant technique of the ukiyoe was used to the shunga.
Therefore, it is said that the most significant technique of the ukiyoe was used for shunga.
Therefore, it is said that the most significant technique of the ukiyoe was used for shunga.

sen.j: 有名な絵師のほとんどがこれを手がけ、狩野派・土佐派の絵師達までもが描いた。
sen.e: Most of the famous painters, even painters of the Kano School and the Tosa School painted the shunga.
Most of the famous painters, even painters of the Kano School and the Tosa School painted shunga.
Most of the famous painters, even painters of the Kano School and the Tosa School painted shunga.

sen.j: 版画として大量に出回った春画は、その芸術性は高い。
sen.e: As woodblock paints, mass-market shunga had high artistic quality.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shunga widely-circulated as woodblock paints had high artistic quality.
sen.cmt: 「版画として」のかかりが間違っているため修正
sen.e: The shunga widely-circulated as woodblock paints had high artistic quality.

sen.j: 性教育のため、性文化の追求、また思想、宗教的意味合いがあったかなどもわかっていない。
sen.e: It was not known if it was for sex education or for the pursuit of sex culture, or philosophical or religious implication.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was not known if it was for sex education or for the pursuit of sex culture, or philosophical or religious implication.
It was not known if it was for sex education or for the pursuit of sex culture, or philosophical or religious implication.

sen.j: どういう人達に需要があり、なぜ高い技術が要求されたか、今後の研究課題ともいえる。
sen.e: It may be a future research issue that by what kind of people it was wanted or why the high technique was required.
It may be a future research issue that by what kind of people it was wanted or why the high technique was required.
It may be a future research issue that by what kind of people it was wanted or why the high technique was required.

sen.j: また春画根付には、老男女、動物もの、聖人、果物などもある。
sen.e: Also the models of the shunga netsuke (miniature carving attached to the end of a cord hanging from a pouch) were old men and women, animals, the saints, and fruits.
Also the models of shunga netsuke (miniature carving attached to the end of a cord hanging from a pouch) were old men and women, animals, the saints, and fruits.
Also the models of shunga netsuke (miniature carving attached to the end of a cord hanging from a pouch) were old men and women, animals, the saints, and fruits.

sen.j: ただ、幕府による取締りの対策として、作者、絵師、版元を分からないよう画中に隠号という形で記した。
sen.e: However, shielded from the control by the Edo Shognate, the names of the original writers, painters and publishers were expressed in the pictures as hidden signatures to disguise their identities.
However, shielded from the control of the Edo Shognate, the names of the original writers, painters and publishers were expressed in the pictures as hidden signatures to disguise their identities.

sen.j: 明治に入り、次第に写真に取って代わられるようになった。
sen.e: In the Meiji Period, photographs came to replace the shunga.
In the Meiji Period, photographs came to replace shunga.
In the Meiji period, photographs came to replace shunga.

sen.j: 改定律令違式罪目中に、春画およびその類の諸器物を販売する者を笞罪に処し、また没収を付加した。
sen.e: According to the criminal laws 改定律令違式罪目 in the Meiji Period, those who sell the shunga or like that were punished by caning and seized it.
sen.cmt: (改定律令違式罪目) 意味と読み方が不明です
sen.e: According to the criminal laws 改定律令違式罪目 in the Meiji Period, those who sell shunga or the like were punished by caning and had their shunga seized.
sen.cmt: thatを削除seized it→had their shunga seized
sen.e: According to the criminal laws 改定律令違式罪目 in the Meiji period, those who sell shunga or the like were punished by caning and had their shunga seized.

sen.j: 現代においては、芸術作品（エロティカ）として社会的に高く評価されており、猥褻出版物としての扱いは受けていない。
sen.e: In these dsays, the shuga is valued at the social level as a work of art (erotica), not being regarded as pornography.
In these days, the shuga is socially valued as a work of art (erotica), not being regarded as pornography.
sen.cmt: at the social level→sociallydaysのスペルミスを修正
sen.e: In these days, the shuga is socially valued as a work of art (erotica), not being regarded as pornography.

sen.j: 幕末におきたジャポニズムによって、西洋では浮世絵がもてはやされた。
sen.e: In the end of the Edo Period, ukiyoe was valued in the West due to Japanism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the end of the Edo Period, ukiyoe was valued in the West due to Japonism.
In the end of the Edo period, ukiyoe was valued in the West due to Japonism.

sen.j: 春画は画題が猥褻であるとの理由から嫌われ、輸出には供されなかった。
sen.e: Shunga was in disfavor doe to so-called its rudeness and it was not exported.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shunga was in disfavor due to its vulgarness and it was not exported.
sen.cmt: dueのスペルミスを修正so-colledを削除rudeness→vulgarness
sen.e: Shunga was in disfavor due to its vulgarness and it was not exported.

sen.j: しかし、次第に外国人好みの美人画が不足していったことから、明治末期から大正にかけて局部を書き換えた春画や、複数の春画を切り張りして一枚の美人画に仕立て上げたものを輸出するようになっていった。
sen.e: However, from the end of the Meiji Period to the Taisho Period, when bijinga (beautiful women's pictures) that foreigners liked gradually became out of stock, the shuga, which was partly repainted around genitals and collarged to make a woman's picture were exported.
